title: Humorless CNN fact-checks hilarious Elon Musk meme mocking them, so he mocked them some more
description:
I had every intention of going a day without Elon Musk content. But to quote western philosopher AEW's Excalibur, you GOT to give the people what they want. Plus if CNN found a way to bottle the lack of self-awareness in this tweet, they could have afforded to feed Brian "I'm Not a Potato, I'm a Man" Stelter for another year.

Elon Musk goes and buys Twitter. And both the left and the media (but I repeat myself) are in DEFCON eleventy meltdown mode over the fact there will be a social media app they no longer control the flow of information from. Elon Musk believes in free speech. Corporate media believes in free speech they agree with. The speech they don't agree with will literally kill democracy literally with its bare hands.

So Elon posted a funny meme about it.

pic.twitter.com/KZ7jeME3AX
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022

It's understandable why people at CNN might be confused and think that was a real headline on the news-content site. It's not that far off from what CNN employees say out loud. But it's a clear meme and a sloppy one at that.

CNN didn't find it funny. They felt it necessary to not only fact-check the meme but be ginormous biyatches about it.

This headline never appeared on CNN. Be better. pic.twitter.com/n8xGp2Z6qm
— CNN Communications (@CNNPR) November 28, 2022

Elon laughed in their face.

Lmaoooo
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022

What I'd like to know is how many CNN journalismers does it take to fact-check a meme. If CNN runs itself like Twitter use to, I think ten. One person who knows how to use social media, and nine managers to micro-manage that person. I'm sure they called an all-hand meeting too, which we all know is the Taylor Lorenz of work meetings.

I was not able to go a day without Elon content. Tomorrow isn't looking good either.

The Twitter Files on free speech suppression soon to be published on Twitter itself. The public deserves to know what really happened …
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022

Drip. Drip. Drip. Bring on the chaos!

title: Watch: US soccer captain shuts down smug Iranian reporter's attempt to blame America for racial discrimination
description:
The World Cup is being played in Qatar as we speak. It's the first World Cup played in the Arab world, a region not known for its robust civil rights. Team USA plays Iran tomorrow while there are massive civil rights protests happening in the country. It's been a major political topic at the World Cup, and the Iranian government is none too happy about it. They had their Iranian reporters attempt to corner Team USA Captain Tyler Adams, wondering what it's like for HIM to play for a country that has so much racism and discrimination going on.

Adams, who is of mixed race, wasn't having it.

CAPTAIN Tyler Adams 🇺🇸🫡🫡🫡

(Via @relevo, h/t @usmntonly)

pic.twitter.com/OLoABTB1eB
— American Hooligans 🇺🇸⚽️ (@AmericanHoolis) November 28, 2022
There's discrimination everywhere you go. In the US, we're continuing to make progress every single day. It's a process, and as long as you see progress that's the most important thing.

Thank God it was Tyler who got the question and not what's her face.

It was a weird day where, apparently, the Iranian press corps has been studying the journalisming of their American counterparts and taking every attempt to politicize sports.

Gregg Berhalter and Tyler Adams have now been asked about systemic racism in the U.S., the American fleet in the Persian Gulf, high inflation, and why Iranians need a visa to visit the USA but Americans don't need one for Iran.

This press conference has been... different.
— Leander Schaerlaeckens (@LeanderAlphabet) November 28, 2022

The protests started in Iran when a 22-year-old woman died in police detention after being arrested for not adhering to the regime's strict rules on women's dress code. Iranians are publically cutting their hair and burning head coverings in the woman's memory and in protest.

The Iranian soccer team, risking retaliation from the Iranian regime, showed solidarity by refusing to sing their own country's National Anthem as it played before a game last week. Supporters of the team were protesting against the regime.

Team Iran went on to lose to England 6-2. Team USA tied England 0-0, which is somehow considered win kinda. Because of this, we play Iran tomorrow, for reasons that only make sence to people who watch soccer.

title: Game On: Elon Musk just blasted Apple CEO Tim Cook, 'why do you hate free speech?'
description:
Shadowy dark money groups funded by shadowy progressives have been cyberbullying advertisers to drop Twitter since Elon Musk took over. They've been doing it ever since Musk announced he was BUYING the company. Now that he owns it, advertisers are caving to the radical activists. Musk has said it's going to get to where he puts people on blast, and it may have started today with Apple.

Per the Chief Twit, "Apple has mostly stopped advertising on Twitter. Do they hate free speech in America?"

Apple has mostly stopped advertising on Twitter. Do they hate free speech in America?
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022

He even called out Apple CEO Tim Cook specifically.

What’s going on here @tim_cook?
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022

Coincidentally enough, Musk isn't the only one questioning Apple's commitment to free speech. Do you know those protests in China? Apple is on the side of the communist government.

Apple has released a software update limiting the use of AirDrop in China in light of recent protests.

AirDrop was being used by protesters to transmit info directly phone to phone, bypassing the Great Firewall of China. pic.twitter.com/2UNtOeuTBZ
— Whole Mars Catalog (@WholeMarsBlog) November 28, 2022

And right after I pressed the publish button, there were updates. Turns out Apple is threatening to remove Twitter from the app store.

Apple should publish all censorship actions it has taken that affect its customers
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022


Yes
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 28, 2022


If/when Apple responds, I think we know the boilerplate. They will claim it has nothing to do with the shadowy dark money progressive cyberbullies and everything to do with "blah blah blah, we're a global brand, boring boring, we constantly review our ad strategies, etc."

It would be an odd position to take as new user signups on Twitter are at an all-time high, active user minutes are also at an all-time high, and when leftists say that alleged "hate speech" has never been worse, there's ACKSHUALLY been a massive decline.

Slides from my Twitter company talk pic.twitter.com/8LLXrwylta
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 27, 2022

Apple's response will be enlightening. Or, complete bullsh*t. Either way, we at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website are here for the entertaining chaos.

It will be fascinating to see if Elon calls out more companies AND names the activists who are bullying companies to bend the knee to their agenda. In less than a month, Musk has exposed everything we assumed Twitter was doing internally to stifle opposing viewpoints. He I, in theory, do the same to the radical left at large. Keep popping that popcorn.

Editor’s Note

title: Watch: Disney's latest attempt to go woke has them going broke to the tune of $100 million
description:
Disney’s newest attempt at wokifying media has failed miserably. “Strange World” which features a gay teen romance and climate change commentary is on track to lose Disney $100M, according to The Wrap.

The flop is so big that it is on par with another historic bomb that the studio released on Thanksgiving weekend two decades ago: “Treasure Planet,” the most prominent in a string of theatrical busts that helped lead to the ouster of then-CEO Michael Eisner and paved the way for the rise of Bob Iger, who is now returning to take charge of Disney after the brief, tumultuous reign of Bob Chapek.

Here's a clip:

Some critics blame the marketing of the movie. Crowder and the gang discussed Disney's latest epic fail in comparison with other, non-woke movies that have come out.

CHINA'S EPIC ANTI-COMMUNIST UPRISING EXPLAINED! | Louder with Crowder youtu.be

Let’s compare recent Hollywood successes and Disney failures:

Paramount’s Top Gun: Maverick made $1.45 billion in its worldwide box office sales, and Paramount Pictures stock price INCREASED right before Top Gun came out.

In comparison, Disney's LightyearLightyear only made $200M, by comparison. And Disney’s stock price plummeted before the movie's release.

To try and help correct the course, Disney brought back Bob Iger as CEO less than a year after retiring. Bob Chapek Is OUT, even after Tim Allen gave him a Santa Clause series!

This is a cultural win, and your choices do matter!

title: OnlyFans declares filming sex content in a public school goes too far, bans teacher who did so
description:
OnlyFans frowns upon filming sex content in a public school and has banned a teacher who did from the platform. Now the (former) teacher lost her job AND her platform.

Samantha Peer, aka Khloe Karter, was a teacher at the Thunderbolt Middle School in Arizona. She also sold herself on OnlyFans, and after filming content IN HER CLASSROOM was fired. Turns out, middle schools aren't the only people who think that's a bad idea. Peer said on a TikTok video: "So, it seems OnlyFans deactivated both accounts (refunded all customers/subscribers) and is blocking me from making accounts."

OnlyFans would not respond to Fox News, but told them to read their policy that says the platform "prohibits users from uploading, posting, displaying, or publishing content on the platform that features sexual activities and was recorded or broadcasted from a public place."

So that makes two things you can't do on OnlyFans. You can't film in a public place. And no gun content, as Catalina Hager explains in this tutorial.

View this post on Instagram
A post shared by CATALINA| HAGER (@catalinahager)

To recap, Samantha and Dillon Peer were teachers who filmed their sex work in the classroom THEY worked in. Students found their sexual OnlyFans content on the internet because that's how the internet works. The Peers became unemployed and Samantha attempted to make you feel bad.

My children are the most important thing to me and I'm already spending countless hours outside of my contract time on extra school activities, and I don't think it's fair that I have to sacrifice my own children's time because our professional salary did not pay enough.

We here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website are as open-minded and tolerant as the next right-wing blog. Some of you have been selling yourselves on OnlyFans from the comfort of your own home. We'll file that under "you do you."

Allow us to provide some life advice: Depending on your primary source of income, you should keep your kink in your house. If you think someone won't find something on the internet, they already have. And always read the fine print of policies and terms of service.

I'm sure there is a social media platform that allows you to film in schools. They probably even get off on it. Turns out, OnlyFans is not that platform.

title: Watch: China erupts in massive protest over government lockdowns (that leftists would implement here if allowed)
description:
It popped off in China over the weekend. The communist Chinese government implemented one "SCHMOVID-zero" policy too many, and the people are revolting. As opposed to when they protested in America, Australia, or Europe, no one is telling these protesters they stink on ice. Or worse, that they're anti-the science. Did I mention Australia?

I'm relying on Google translate for accuracy, but people have taken to the streets of Bejing.

北京 0:44左右 新源里
民众高喊口号，有市民在现场演讲 pic.twitter.com/AMj3x7wATY
— 李老师不是你老师 (@whyyoutouzhele) November 27, 2022

And in Wuhan (Wuhan, got you all in check). Protesters are chanting "The epidemic started in Wuhan, and it will end in Wuhan."

【武汉人推牆起义】
【武汉居民 ：「疫情从武汉开始，就从武汉结束」】
中国示威浪潮遍地开花，走上街头的人数远超防疫人员，越来越多社区的防疫人员已撤走，到周六、日，民众不约而同走到街上，推翻各式各样的障碍物。
在武汉汉正街，居民合力把小区的巨型铁闸推翻，走到街上跟其他小区居民汇合。 pic.twitter.com/1Y8awUcsuK
— 自由亚洲电台 (@RFA_Chinese) November 27, 2022

Chinese citizens are even speaking out AGAINST the communist government. Which in China, takes some stones.

Tsinghua university right now👇🏼 city after city seeing protests small and large against Zero Covid policies and against excesses of Communist Party rule - every hour there seems to be a new one pic.twitter.com/7CbUtzNmjR
— Emily Feng 冯哲芸 (@EmilyZFeng) November 27, 2022


Numerous areas in China are reportedly protesting the Covid zero lockdowns, per AFP, such as in Shanghai with citizens chanting "CCP, step down" and "Xi Jinping, step down." pic.twitter.com/NDB0s7hkYB
— unusual_whales (@unusual_whales) November 27, 2022

We should support all people who are standing against communism and fighting for freedom. And taking a lap around the internet, no one appears to be siding with the government against the Chinese citizens. Well, almost no one. There are a few leftists who are jealous of China's control over the populace.

There is no lasting “natural immunity” to COVID. You can get covid over and over and over again bc there are so many endlessly evolving strains and antibodies wane. Also, choosing not to kill off millions of vulnerable people (as the US is doing) isn’t a “critical flaw” https://t.co/SFx4qocp8o
— SUBSCRIBE TO MY SUBSTACK (@TaylorLorenz) November 26, 2022

But let's not forget how many people who are now opposing the government lockdowns in China LOVED the government lockdown policies that were instituted against their own citizens in their own country. When those happened, anyone who spoke out against the government was called a grandma-killer and told that they were being selfish for wanting freedom.

It's not like what the Chinese government is telling their citizens sounds all that different from what our government was telling us. Back in April, the last time it popped off, China was telling people to "control their desire for freedom." Anthony Fauci said the same thing to Americans on multiple occasions.

The largest quarantine camp in China's Guangzhou city is being built.
It has 90,000 isolation pods. pic.twitter.com/7VdAJpki5q
— Songpinganq (@songpinganq) November 27, 2022

The same Anthony Fauci who is jealous of China's ability to lockdown their government. You wonder if the people lighting their Fauci Prayer Candles as they tweet their support of the Chinese citizens miss the irony. Or how they are going to react now that the new American leftist buzzword has dropped: 'tridemic.'

There is going to be a new pandemic. There is going to be a new Fauci. We'll see how many people support lockdown protests when it's their own neighbors speaking up again.

title: Super Bowl MVP unloads on Balenciaga over kiddie-porn-themed ad (Kim Kardashian... not so much)
description:
Super Bowl MVP Cooper Kupp issued a strong statement against Balenciaga's ad campaign featuring little girls with BDSM teddy bears that referenced a kiddie porn Supreme Court case. Kim Kardashian. who is in business with the company, was weak in responding to the ad featuring their collaboration with Adidas.

Point of information: This is the same Adidas who canceled Ye, and the same Kim Kardashian who... you know.

Kupp issued a strong statement blasting the company and called on others with sizable platforms to do the same: "To try to be a voice for our children, who rely on the protection of the men and women that were entrusted the responsibility of nurturing them and raising them up: please make yourself aware of the attack against our young ones by Balenciaga, and ensure that they are held responsible for it. For those of us in positions to create change in the way that companies manipulate people and advertise evil, please stand up!"

pic.twitter.com/8Y4uGBZOoX
— Cooper Kupp (@CooperKupp) November 27, 2022

Kim Kardashian, who is in business with the company, needed a few days after the drama to reflect on how it made her feel. And while she shares our disgust, she has yet to determine whether she will stop working with the company.

As a mother of four, I have been shaken by the disturbing images. The safety of children must be held with the highest regard and any attempts to normalize child abuse of any kind should have no place in our society — period.
— Kim Kardashian (@KimKardashian) November 27, 2022


As for my future with Balenciaga, I am currently re-evaluating my relationship with the brand, basing it off their willingness to accept accountability for something that should have never happened to begin with — & the actions I am expecting to see them take to protect children.
— Kim Kardashian (@KimKardashian) November 28, 2022

Balenciaga is a high-end fashion company. If you want to remortgage your house, you can buy a pocketbook with the Adidas stripes on it. Or, you can be a celebrity/influencer and get one for free. Their advertisement featured little girls holding teddy bears in bondage gear.

the brand "Balenciaga" just did a uh..... interesting... photoshoot for their new products recently which included a very purposely poorly hidden court document about 'virtual child porn'

normal stuff pic.twitter.com/zjMN5WhZ0s
— shoe (@shoe0nhead) November 21, 2022

As if the little girls holding bondage bears didn't drive home the message clear enough, on the desk next to the pocketbook there was a copy of United States v. Williams. It's a Supreme Court case about distributing child pornography. The ad makers felt that, as part of an ad campaign featuring little girls with bondage bears, a copy of the ruling hidden in the clutter on the desk was the one thing needed to tie it all together.

While Twitter was quick to notice, everyone at Balenciaga missed that tiny detail. The company apologized and is suing the ad company responsible.

Unclear is if they also missed the photos of the little girls selling BDSM before those photos went up on the Balenciaga website. But Balenciaga is sorry about those too.
